g.text: Matsui et al. Magnesium-Based Intermetallic Anode Active Materials
is highly dependent upon the reaction kinetics, because the
hydrolysis of the intermetallics is fundamentally same as the
electrochemical reaction. In the hydrolysis process of the
intermetallic anodes, the reduction of the proton in the water
initiates the oxidation of the Mg
in the host structure. The Mg
still remains even after the 10 days of the reaction, while
kinetics of the hydrolysis process of the Mg
faster than that of the Mg
discussion, the fast reaction kinetics of the hydrolysis process
well matches with the electrochemical activity of the intermetallic
XRD patterns for the stability test:
powder in ambient atmosphere and small amount of water.
powder immersed in the excess amount of water.
diffusion pathways by BVS mapping in Mg
